alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 04 at 6:17PM MDT until May 05 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FRIDAY AFTERNOON FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 10% OR LESS, 20FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND HIGH TO VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO, THE GUADALUPE AND DELAWARE MOUNTAINS, AND EASTERN CULBERSON COUNTY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FRIDAY AFTERNOON FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 10% OR LESS, 20FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND HIGH TO VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO, THE GUADALUPE AND DELAWARE MOUNTAINS, AND EASTERN CULBERSON COUNTY... * AFFECTED AREA...Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains, Chaves Plains, Eddy Plains, Lea, Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet, Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains and Eastern Culberson County. * TIMING...Friday afternoon * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 7 percent. * RFTI...4 to 6 or near critical to critical. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions will have the potential to grow quickly into dangerous wind-driven wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains
